alert.note: Alert for Tulare (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 25 at 2:16AM PST until February 25 at 11:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Fresno, Kern, Kings and Tulare. * WHEN...Until 515 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 216 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fresno, Visalia, Clovis, Tulare, Hanford, Corcoran, Lemoore, Sanger, Reedley, Selma, Dinuba, Parlier, Earlimart, Kingsburg, Home Garden, Armona, Traver, Stratford, London and Lanare. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
